name: design_usability_v7
description: Scored after every UI-facing task. Benchmarked against Uber-level usability.

first_use_clarity.desc: Can a new user accomplish the primary task within 60 seconds without instructions?
first_use_clarity.benchmark: Uber: open app → book ride in 3 taps

navigation.desc: Max 2 clicks to any feature. Clear back/home. No dead ends.
navigation.benchmark: Bottom nav or sidebar always visible. Current location always clear.

visual_hierarchy.desc: Most important info largest/boldest. Actions clearly distinguished from content.
visual_hierarchy.benchmark: KPIs big and bold at top. Charts below. Details on drill-down.

consistency.desc: Same patterns across all dashboards. Same colours mean same things.
consistency.benchmark: Revenue always green. Costs always red. Same layout grid everywhere.

error_communication.desc: Errors explain what happened AND what to do next. Never technical jargon.
error_communication.benchmark: Not 'Error 500'. Instead: 'Could not load sales data. Check database connection in Settings.'

responsiveness.desc: Works on desktop, tablet, phone. No horizontal scroll. Touch targets ≥44px.
responsiveness.benchmark: Streamlit handles basic responsive. Custom CSS for touch targets.

loading_feedback.desc: User always knows something is happening. Spinners, progress bars, skeleton screens.
loading_feedback.benchmark: Never a blank screen. Show loading state within 200ms.

accessibility.desc: Colour contrast ≥4.5:1. Labels on all inputs. Keyboard navigable.
accessibility.benchmark: WCAG 2.1 AA minimum. Alt text on charts.

when_to_score: After every task that creates or modifies UI elements (dashboards, forms, reports, error messages)
